translations: n．陈词滥调：陈旧、平庸、无趣的观点或说法，缺乏新意。
· His speech was full of platitudes.
他的演讲充满了陈词滥调。

sentences.sentence: He was seen on TV delivering platitudes about the crisis in a monotone voice.
sentences.translation: 人们看到他在电视上念经似地就危机问题老调重弹。

sentences.sentence: Why couldn't he say something vital and original instead of just spouting the same old platitudes?
sentences.translation: 他为什么不能说点重要的、有新意的东西，而不只是喋喋不休地讲些陈词滥调呢？

sentences.sentence: Avoid platitudes, such as a Time heals all wounds.a.
sentences.translation: 避免满口的陈腔滥调，比如“时间会治愈一切的伤。”
